{{cpp/io/basic_ostream/title|basic_ostream}}
{{cpp/io/basic_ostream/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|1=
explicit basic_ostream( std::basic_streambuf&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;* sb );
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++11|1=
protected:
basic_ostream( const basic_ostream&amp; rhs ) = delete;
}}
{{dcl|num=3|since=c++11|1=
protected:
basic_ostream( basic_ostream&amp;&amp; rhs );
}}
{{dcl end}}

@1@ Constructs the {{tt|basic_ostream}} object, assigning initial values to the base class by calling {{lc|std::basic_ios::init|basic_ios::init(sb)}}.

@2@ The copy constructor is protected, and is deleted. Output streams are not copyable.

@3@ The move constructor uses {{c|basic_ios&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;::move(rhs)}} to move all {{tt|basic_ios}} members, except for the {{tt|rdbuf()}}, from {{c|rhs}} into {{c|*this}}. This move constructor is protected: it is called by the move constructors of movable output stream classes {{lc|std::basic_ofstream}} and {{lc|std::basic_ostringstream}}, which know how to correctly move the associated streambuffer.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|sb|streambuffer to use as output sequence}}
{{par|rhs|basic_ostream to initialize from}}
{{par end}}

===Notes===
Because {{lc|std::basic_ios::init|basic_ios::init(sb)}} sets {{tt|badbit}} when {{c|sb}} is a null pointer, and because {{l2tt|cpp/io/basic_ostream/sentry}} does nothing if the stream is already in a failed state, writing to a stream constructed from a null pointer {{c|sb}} is a no-op.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;
#include &lt;utility&gt;

int main()
{
    // ERROR: copy ctor is deleted
//  std::ostream myout(std::cout);

    // OK: shares buffer with cout
    std::ostream myout(std::cout.rdbuf());

    // ERROR: move constructor is protected
//  std::ostream s2(std::move(std::ostringstream() &lt;&lt; 7.1));

    // OK: move ctor called through the derived class
    std::ostringstream s2(std::ostringstream() &lt;&lt; 7.1);
    myout &lt;&lt; s2.str() &lt;&lt; '\n';

    std::ostream dev_null{nullptr}; // see Notes above
    dev_null &lt;&lt; "no-op";
}
|output=
7.1
}}
